data.enText: not good enough for plants to grow on it
a barren landscape (= one that is empty, with few plants)
not able to produce children or young animals
not producing anything useful or successful

data.chText: 这个队将会在经历这段低潮时期之后再创佳绩。
data.enText: The team will come through this barren patch and start to win again.

ex.chText: 那栋旧楼现在空无一人了。
ex.enText: That old building now stands completely deserted.
The streets are deserted at night.

ex.chText: 这片贫瘠的土地无法种植庄稼。
ex.enText: No crops can be grown on this barren land.

ex.chText: 从这栋房子的屋顶只能看到一个光秃秃的山坡。
ex.enText: Only a barren hillside can be seen from the top of this building.

synonyms.bx: 指土地或土壤不肥沃、不长草木的。

ex.chText: 村民们卖出了一大片荒地。
ex.enText: The villagers sold a wild stretch of land.

ex.chText: 这片原始风景吸引了数千名游客。
ex.enText: The wild landscape attracts thousands of tourists.

synonyms.bx: 指土地未被人类开发利用过的。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：空寂的，荒芜的

tr: an uninhabited wilderness that is worthless for cultivation
example: the trackless wastes of the desert
the sentence was devoid of meaning
learned early in his marriage that he was sterile
the bleak treeless regions of the high Andes
the desolate surface of the moon

value.def: A barren landscape is dry and bare, and has very few plants and no trees.

example.ex: ...the country's landscape of high barren mountains.
example.tran: 该国草木稀少的高山地貌

value.tran: 荒芜的；缺少植被的；不毛的

value.def: Barren land consists of soil that is so poor that plants cannot grow in it.

example.ex: He also wants to use the water to irrigate barren desert land.
example.tran: 他也想用这些水灌溉荒漠。

value.def: If you describe something such as an activity or a period of your life as barren, you mean that you achieve no success during it or that it has no useful results.

example.ex: ...politics that are banal and barren of purpose.
...the player, who ended a 14-month barren spell by winning the Tokyo event in October...
example.tran: 这名选手赢得了10月的东京赛事，终结了长达14个月不胜的魔咒

example.ex: As the leaves of autumn wither and fall, so has my own life become barren.
example.tran: 我的生命就如秋叶般枯萎凋零。

value.tran: 无用的；无益的；无效果的

example.ex: ...a film that would force audiences to confront the barrenness of contemporary life.
example.tran: 一部会迫使观众直面当前空虚生活的电影

value.def: If you describe a room or a place as barren, you do not like it because it has almost no furniture or other objects in it.

example.ex: The room was austere, nearly barren of furniture or decoration...
example.tran: 房间非常简朴，几乎没有任何家具和装饰。

example.ex: Six stale loaves of brown bread formed a dark blot on the otherwise barren shelves.
example.tran: 6条变质的黑面包在原本空荡荡的架子上堆出了一个黑点儿。

value.def: A barren woman or female animal is unable to have babies.

example.ex: He prayed that his barren wife would one day have a child.
example.tran: 他祈祷自己不孕的妻子有朝一日能怀上宝宝。

example.ex: ...a ceremony designed to cure women of barrenness.
example.tran: 为治愈妇女不孕举行的仪式
